text: Effect of PTX on <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production in the presence of PKA inhibition

text: The role of PKA in PTX - induced downregulation of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production in LPS - stimulated mononuclear cells was assessed by treating mononuclear cells with H89 , a PKA inhibitor , prior to LPS and PTX exposure .

text: The addition PTX to LPS - stimulated cells resulted in a reduction in <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , similar to that observed in our previous experiments ( 529 pg / mL +/- 112 vs . 37 pg / mL +/- 10 ; P < 0.01 ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation resulted <extra_id_0> Theme reduction <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Negative_regulation reduction <extra_id_0> Theme TNF-alpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: Pre-incubation of cells with H89 prior to LPS and PTX exposure did not result in any significant modulation of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production when compared to that demonstrated with PTX alone ( P = 0.2 ; Figure 5 ) .

text: These results suggest that downregulation of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production by PTX in LPS - stimulated mononuclear cells is , at least in part , PKA - independent .
